perturbation.original_text: 2.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year, and shall continue in full force and effect thereafter until terminated by either Party by providing thirty (30) calendar days' prior written notice of termination to the other Party (such fifteen (15) Contract Year period, as may be further extended as provided herein is referred to as the "Term").
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue in full force and effect until the end of the fifteenth (15th) Contract Year, and shall continue in full force and effect thereafter until terminated by either Party at any time, without prior written notice to the other Party (such fifteen (15) Contract Year period, as may be further extended as provided herein is referred to as the "Term").
perturbation.explanation: The original text stipulates a 30-day written notice for termination after the initial 15-year term. The modified version allows termination "at any time, without prior written notice," directly contradicting the original provision. This creates uncertainty regarding the proper procedure for terminating the agreement after the initial term.

perturbation.original_text: 16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may not be assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed, except as provided below.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.1 Restrictions on Assignment. This Agreement may be freely assigned, disposed of, alienated or otherwise transferred by either Party, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent may be withheld, conditioned or delayed for any reason or no reason.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that assignment requires the other party's consent, which "shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed". The modified version states that assignment can occur freely without consent, but retains the phrase about consent being withheld, conditioned, or delayed for any reason, thus creating a contradiction, as free assignment does not require consent at all. This generates uncertainty about whether assignment is permissible with or without consent.

perturbation.original_text:
19.14 Confidentiality.

(a) Each Party agrees that it shall maintain all terms and conditions of this Agreement in confidence, and that it shall not cause or permit disclosure thereof without the express written consent of the other Party. The standard of care to be employed by each Party with respect to the other Party's confidential information shall be the standard of care employed by a reasonable person in protecting confidential information.

(b) Permitted Disclosures. Notwithstanding Section 19.14(a) of this Agreement, disclosures of any terms and provisions of this Agreement otherwise prohibited may be made by a Party (i) to the extent necessary for such Party to enforce its rights hereunder against the other Party; (ii) to the extent to which a Party is required to disclose all or part of this Agreement by a statute or by the order or rule of a court, agency, or other governmental body exercising jurisdiction over the subject matter hereof, by order, by regulations, or by other compulsory process (including, but not limited to, deposition, subpoena, interrogatory, or request for production of documents); (iii) to the extent required by the applicable regulations of a securities or commodities exchange; (iv) to a third Person in connection with a proposed sale or other transfer of a Party's interest in this Agreement, provided such third Person agrees in writing to be bound by confidentiality terms no less restrictive than those set forth in this Section 19.14; (v) to its own directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives; (vi) to an Affiliate; (vii) to a co-working interest owner or royalty owner of Shipper Product delivered hereunder, provided such co-working interest owner or royalty owner agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Section 19.14; (viii) to the extent any such terms or provisions become public information through no fault of any Party; or (ix) to a bank or other financial institution, and their agents and representatives, in connection with a Party arranging for funding.
perturbation.changed_text:
19.14 Confidentiality.

(a) Each Party agrees that it shall maintain all terms and conditions of this Agreement in confidence, and that it shall not cause or permit disclosure thereof without the express written consent of the other Party. The standard of care to be employed by each Party with respect to the other Party's confidential information shall be the standard of care employed by a reasonable person in protecting confidential information.

(b) Permitted Disclosures. Notwithstanding Section 19.14(a) of this Agreement, disclosures of any terms and provisions of this Agreement otherwise prohibited must be made by a Party (i) to the extent necessary for such Party to enforce its rights hereunder against the other Party; (ii) to the extent to which a Party is required to disclose all or part of this Agreement by a statute or by the order or rule of a court, agency, or other governmental body exercising jurisdiction over the subject matter hereof, by order, by regulations, or by other compulsory process (including, but not limited to, deposition, subpoena, interrogatory, or request for production of documents); (iii) to the extent required by the applicable regulations of a securities or commodities exchange; (iv) to a third Person in connection with a proposed sale or other transfer of a Party's interest in this Agreement, provided such third Person agrees in writing to be bound by confidentiality terms no less restrictive than those set forth in this Section 19.14; (v) to its own directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives; (vi) to an Affiliate; (vii) to a co-working interest owner or royalty owner of Shipper Product delivered hereunder, provided such co-working interest owner or royalty owner agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Section 19.14; (viii) to the extent any such terms or provisions become public information through no fault of any Party; or (ix) to a bank or other financial institution, and their agents and representatives, in connection with a Party arranging for funding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that disclosures "may be made" under specified circumstances, which implied optionality. The modified text changes this to disclosures "must be made" under those same circumstances. This contradicts the general principle of confidentiality established in Section 19.14(a) which states information cannot be disclosed without written consent of the other party, but (b) is now saying that it must be disclosed in all the scenarios. This creates uncertainty whether the disclosure is required, and potentially conflicting obligations, for a party. It generates doubt about the extent of confidentiality provided for in the agreement.
